required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Antithrombin to Improve Thromboprophylaxis and Reduce the Incidence of Trauma-Related Venous Thromboembolism
clinical_study.official_title: Antithrombin to Improve Thromboprophylaxis and Reduce the Incidence of Trauma-Related Venous Thromboembolism (TRAIT)

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if additional interventions will assist with decreasing the risk and/or severity of thromboembolism (clotting complications) in patients who have experienced a major traumatic event.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: This will be a double-blind study.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with incidences of venous thromboembolism (VTE )
Number of participants with incidence of antifactor Xa (anti-FXa) of ≥0.2 IU/mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Time taken to achieve anti-FXa of ≥0.2 IU/mL

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the time of hospital admission to the time of hospital discharge or 30 days (whichever occurs first)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of incidences of participants with other thrombotic complications (arterial thrombosis, myocardial infarction, stroke)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the time of hospital admission to the time of hospital discharge or 30 days (whichever occurs first)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of incidences of participants with bleeding events (interoperative bleeding, abdominal bleeding)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the time of hospital admission to the time of hospital discharge or 30 days (whichever occurs first)
from the time of hospital admission to the time of hospital discharge or 30 days (whichever occurs first)
from the time of hospital admission to the time of hospital discharge or 30 days (whichever occurs first)
from the time of hospital admission to the time of hospital discharge or 30 days (whichever occurs first)
from the time of hospital admission up to hospital day 7
from the time of hospital admission up to hospital day 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in level of the endothelial marker syndecan-1 as assessed by a blood test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: time of hospital admission, day1, day2, day 3, day 4, day 5, day6, day 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in level of the endothelial marker thrombomodulin as assessed by a blood test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of hospital admission to day 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in level of Inflammatory marker Tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNFα) as assessed by a blood test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of hospital admission to day 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in level of Inflammatory marker Interleukin-8 (IL-8) as assessed by a blood test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of hospital admission to day 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in level of Inflammatory marker Interleukin-6(IL-6) as assessed by a blood test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: time of hospital admission, day1, day2, day 3, day 4, day 5, day6, day 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in level of Inflammatory marker Interleukin-1 beta (IL1b) as assessed by a blood test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of hospital admission to day 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in level of Inflammatory marker Interleukin-1 alpha (IL1a) as assessed by a blood test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of hospital admission to day 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in level of Inflammatory marker Interferon -gamma (INFg) as assessed by a blood test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of hospital admission to day 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with In-hospital mortality
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the time of hospital admission to the time of hospital discharge or 30 days (whichever occurs first)

intervention.description: Bolus intravenous infusion of Thrombate will be given to achieve antithrombin (AT) activity levels at 150% after the 3rd dose of Enoxaparin. The dose will be based on patient weight.
Normal Saline will be given as one time IV after the 3rd dose of Enoxaparin. The dose will be based on patient weight.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Highest level of trauma activation or upgrade to highest level
- Polytraumatic injuries OR pelvic/long bone fracture
- Admission to trauma ICU or Surgical Intermediate Care Unit (SIMU)
- Informed consent obtained
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prisoners (defined as those directly admitted from correctional facility)
- Known or suspected pregnancy
- ≥ 20% total body surface area (TBSA) burned
- Nonsurvivable head injuries
- Known hematologic or immunologic disorders
- Known prehospital anticoagulant use
- Patients initially placed on unfractionated heparin for thromboprophylaxis
- Known allergy to Antithrombin or it's components
- Enrollment in another interventional study unless approved by Trial Principal Investigator
